title: Writing front-end tests (snapshot test section)
body:
### Environment
Angular 13, node 16

In this case, we will use jest, so we will remove Karma, which is included by default.
```sh
npm run ng add @briebug/jest-schematic
```

Reference: https://github.com/briebug/jest- schematic

### Writing Tests
-  app.component.spec.ts

```ts
  it('snapshot test', () => {
    const fixture = TestBed.createComponent(AppComponent);
    fixture.detectChanges();
    const compiled = fixture.nativeElement;
    expect(compiled).toMatchSnapshot();
  })
```

### Execution

When running tests with `npm run test`, the `__snapshots__` directory is created if there are no existing snapshots or ` - - update- snapshot` is optioned. Here is an example

-  `__snapshots__/app.component.spec.ts.snap`.

```ts
// Jest Snapshot v1, https://goo.gl/fbAQLP

exports[`AppComponent snapshot test 1`] = `
<div
  id="root2"
>
  <mat-toolbar>
    <mat-toolbar-row
      style="padding: 0 16px 0 0;"
    >
      <button
        mat-button=""
      >
...
```
In case of test failure, the following message is displayed.

```bash
    expect(received).toMatchSnapshot()

    Snapshot name: `AppComponent snapshot test 1`

    - Snapshot  - 1
    + Received  + 1

    @@ -1,11 +1,11 @@
      <div
        id="root2"
      >
        <mat-toolbar>
          <mat-toolbar-row
    -       style="padding: 0 16px 0 0;"
    +       style="padding: 1 16px 0 0;"
          >
            <button
              mat-button=""
            >
              <mat-icon>

      33 |     fixture.detectChanges();
      34 |     const compiled = fixture.nativeElement;
    > 35 |     expect(compiled).toMatchSnapshot();
         |                      ^
      36 |   })
      37 | });
      38 |

      at src/app/app.component.spec.ts:35:22
      at ZoneDelegate.Object.<anonymous>.ZoneDelegate.invoke (node_modules/zone.js/bundles/zone-testing-bundle.umd.js:407:30)
      at ProxyZoneSpec.Object.<anonymous>.ProxyZoneSpec.onInvoke (node_modules/zone.js/bundles/zone-testing-bundle.umd.js:3765:43)
      at ZoneDelegate.Object.<anonymous>.ZoneDelegate.invoke (node_modules/zone.js/bundles/zone-testing-bundle.umd.js:406:56)
      at Zone.Object.<anonymous>.Zone.run (node_modules/zone.js/bundles/zone-testing-bundle.umd.js:167:47)
      at Object.wrappedFunc (node_modules/zone.js/bundles/zone-testing-bundle.umd.js:4250:34)

 › 1 snapshot failed.
Snapshot Summary
 › 1 snapshot failed from 1 test suite. Inspect your code changes or re-run jest with `-u` to update them.

Test Suites: 1 failed, 1 total
Tests:       1 failed, 2 passed, 3 total
Snapshots:   1 failed, 1 total

Ran all test suites.
```

### Meaning of the test

When modifications are made to the front end, the impact of the modifications can be lightly asserted.

The issues are as follows

-  Cannot assert unless css is written inline in style format
-  Components that are displayed according to conditions need to be patched and asserted separately (since it is slow to take a snapshot every time).

The dilemma is especially acute with css, which needs to be inline to be seen in tests, but we don't want to reduce readability by writing css inline.

### Notes.

The `__snapshots__` directory may not look like much, but it needs to be managed by git.

### General Comments

Well, this is a test at the level of a light understanding without excessive expectations.
